Header: North Korea fires more missiles as South begins joint drill with US
Content: North Korea has fired two unidentified missiles, its fourth such launch in less than two weeks. They were fired from South Hwanghae province across the peninsula into the sea to the east. The North again expressed anger at US-South Korean military drills that began yesterday. It says they violate agreements reached with US President Donald Trump and South Koreaâ€™s President Moon Jae-in. While the main drills will start on 11 August, low-key preparation has begun.
